I refuse to go there ever again or spend any money in there, and I will be sure to spread the word on how they run their business!

text: Never shopping here again.  One of my sales reps reached out to see if they would be interested in us sending them a holiday sample box. She was treated absolutely terrible.  There exact words were: "It's the holidays, if your line was good enough to be in our store it would be by now".   That's the kind of attitude that gets you left in the dust.

name: Ryan Grant
text: Got a hat from here, there was a small issue with it and the helpful staff sent me a replacement very promptly. Great customer service.

name: James Cain
text:
The best of the best!  A Tuscsaloosa tradition for over 40 years.  Suits and sports coats expertly fitted with service and expertise that you simply can’t find anymore.  Quality is the best you can find.  I am still wearing suits that I bought there 15 years ago!   The owner has an eye for the next big thing in fashion. And he brings it to Tuscaloosa before you can find it anywhere else.
Your new shirt will be steamed while you wait so it’s ready to wear for that big occasion.  Your pants and jacket will be fitted and altered to give you that custom made look.
If you want the best service and best selection, go to The Shirt Shop, a Tuscaloosa icon.

name: Sabrina Steuber
text: I have only visited your store once when I visited Tuscaloosa and my experience was a positive one, I truly love all the game day shirts! I am an online shopper and always end up purchasing your Comfort Colors elephant shirts/tank tops. Shipping is very fast and great quality as usual! Love this store. Roll Tide!

name: Cristine Kuo
text: I absolutely love this store! I usually order online since I live in Tennessee, but whenever I order their merchandise it ships promptly and the customer service is great. I absolutely LOVE their rival t-shirts. It’s my favorite and I have been ordering all of them for the past several years! Thanks again for making these great shirts!

name: Logan Newsome
text: Shopped here on the Saturday before Christmas and although I don’t usually leave reviews I was impressed with this stores service and quality of their products. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding just the right items for my needs. You will never find this level of service, nor the quality in the big box stores. Thank you Shirt Shop for assisting me in purchasing the best Christmas gifts! I will definitely return.

name: Jeremy Hudson
text: The staff here is what makes this place the best. I’ve never met people who were so into providing the best customer service experience around. I got a size too large in a jacket once and I had to exchange it. Not only did Bethany go find jackets in my size but elected not to charge me the difference in price. I always get the help and knowledge of the products in store to assure I’ve got the right size in my hand at checkout! Not only that, but they are quick to respond to my Instagram messages, and send me products!

name: Tanner Corley
text: they have great staff. helpful in every way possible. very friendly also. if you’re in tuscaloosa stop by and check them out

text: I love the Shirt Shop! Great products and even better customer service! Highly recommend :)

name: Alan Ruth
text: A great store and Charles will definitely take care of you. Visiting from CO and they were very accommodating as we arrived right before closing. They helped my daughter find what she had been looking for. Thank you! Great service!!!

name: Kyle Jernigan
text: See. Leck. Shun.  Selection.  And service.  That's the 2 things I always find at this place. Yes, there is a ton of inventory but that's because they have 100 different options from which to choose - just when picking out a button up shirt. It's the same for slacks or a suit, they have every option you can imagine or have seen online. They don't have " just blue and white" button downs, they have every possible style/color/pattern which is awesome. It's almost hard to make a decision but they help you narrow it down to what you really like. They greet you when you walk in and help you find what you want and they don't show you something you may not like. And then they make sure it fits. Imagine having someone show you around, help you find just what you like, and then making sure it fits you just right. It's one of the finer things you can enjoy.

text: 5 out of 5. Not too much experience with this place, but the few times I have been it has been good. I purchased a high dollar pair of sunglasses from here.  I ended up having an allergic reaction to the nose pads.  I took them back to the store a week later and they had no problem exchanging them for another pair.  Service is always friendly with somebody always asking if you need help when walking in (but not in a pushy kind of way).

text: I have shopped here for many years. Now that I live out of town I still make special trips to come back and shop at the Shirt Shop!!!

text: Customer service was excellent , even with a store full of shoppers.  Great selection and quality.

name: S. B.
text: I went to this store over many years after graduating from Alabama buying $1000's worth of merchandise in the past.  This past year I picked a Peter Millar Windbreaker that Charles Spurlin the owner personally said he would get monogrammed for me, I paid for the windbreaker and the monogram and left expecting to pick up in a week.  I live out of town and made a special trip back to pick up the next week.  On arrival Charles notified me that the logo was printed upside down (duh!) and that he would get another one and have it done with either the retro Alabama logo or get a new windbreaker.  I returned for the third time and he told me it wasn't done and that he would refund my purchase price.  Well Charles you cost me three private trips to your store, endless aggravation of incompetence and not receiving the windbreaker that I chose and paid for.   My time is valuable so we are not "square".  What is even worse, I gave you my number and you said you would call me to let me know what could be done.  Needless to say, I heard nothing.

name: Carly Mullady Cowan
text:
I've ordered online several times and was very excited to bring my upcoming freshman brother to the shop, which carries many items we *would* have been interested in purchasing. I almost purchased groomsman shirts from them last fall and am so relieved I didn't. I will not so much as order online ever again. I'm in my 30s and was well dressed aside from a necessary Columbia rain jacket and was joined by my mother and younger brother. When you walk in, it feels like an episode of Hoarders. Everything is everywhere. Stacks. Piles. Overstuffed racks. No sense of organization. It feels like an overstocked Goodwill with name brand stickers strewn about. Prices may or may not be on items. Seeing how poorly $80+ shirts are kept in the store is a definite turnoff.
Even less settling however, was being followed by the staff as if I was going to stuff their items in my small Kate Spade crossbody bag. Should the three of us separate in the tiny shop, there'd be a person on each of us at the snap of a finger--and this is after I found a staff member's cell phone in a pile of clothes and turned it in to them. As we perused, I heard them complaining "OH. THAT is why they're here. Orientation."
That's when I rounded up the crew and we visited different stores with organization, fantastic selections, and genuinely kind staff.
Save yourself frustration, a headache, and money. Skip this stop.

name: Doug Zeiger
text: Our wedding was planned for May 2nd. Covid-19 became the reality and there was disaster after disaster. We cancelled, replanned, downsized, and resized to accommodate the changing world around us. At the start, I had expert advice and help from Ben who fashioned two outfits for the preceding parties. The styling, the fit, and the attention to detail was superb. If you like things done right, go to Shaia's. But the story continues, for the actual wedding day we had a tuxedo picked out that was being made in Italy. The factory had to shut down due to the virus and in the few weeks leading up to the wedding, I was facing quite the dilemma. Ben called me for a special appointment to come in and see what could be done from what was on hand at the store. Ben and Ken went far beyond the extra mile to make sure I was not only clothed for my wedding, but the tuxedo was classy, comfortable, and contained the right amount of original. I cannot recommend Shaia's any higher. There were even a few other minor disasters with needing a haircut and my brides' dress needing last minute alterations that we took to Ken because he just got things done. This is where you can truly see Ken's kindness. He helped us in a huge way during our time of need. Shaia's is a five star store from every angle thanks to a helpful, accommodating, and knowledgeable staff.

resp.text: Thanks Doug for your sincere review. Congratulations to you and your wife, we can't wait to see the photos.

name: James Crenshaw
text: Shaia's is a family owned men's clothing store that is unparalleled as far as service and selection. The store itself makes finding clothes/shoes fun and interactive, while the exceptional staff go out of their way to help you and ultimately build relationships which will last forever. My father first went to Shaia's in the early 1970's where he bought his first nice sports coat and has been a return customer since. The family atmosphere is one of a kind, and makes this store truly special.

name: Sam Willingham
text: How lucky Birmingham Alabama is to have Shaia's. They have the best selection of finer men's clothing short of Italy. Rarely do you find a store like this that treat's you like family. Do yourself a favor and check them out.

name: Tony Lombardo
text: Shaia's is the best men's clothing store with the best clothes and best staff.  The members of the sales staff never talk down to me. They always give me the dignity, sense of equality, and respect they give all their clients and customers.

name: Will R
text: I have visited shades for more than 60 years. They have always been top of the line and in clothing. They carry a wide variety to suit many customers.

name: Shawn David
text: My husband has only recently been interested in "nice clothes." He's known Ken Shaia for years but we've not shopped there regularly. I decided to take him there for his 50th birthday a couple of years ago. Not only did we have a great time, we got so many timeless pieces that my husband loves. I continue to shop there and build his wardrobe which is the beauty of shopping at Shaia's: nothing trendy; all classic, tailored pieces that make him feel like a million bucks. We can call Shaia's, describe an upcoming event, and they'll have the perfect ensemble put together when we get there or, better yet, something that will go perfectly with the pieces we've already bought. A great place!

name: George
text:
WOW! Absolutely positively the best shopping experience I have ever had. I have an athletic build and finding clothes that fit my physique is impossible. Well, until I met Greg Flowers. He was my consultant, and he gave me the most knowledgable, helpful & educational journey about properly fitting clothes, what a tailor can and cannot do, and how to layer elements together into a cohesive personal style that is all your own. Greg has in-depth knowledge of all the products in the store, how they fit, which brands flatter certain body types, how to build a cohesive wardrobe and what will look good on you in a way that fits your personal style. The atmosphere at the store is relaxing and makes shopping feel like you are strolling around at home chatting with very knowledge and suave friends.

After one visit I am a full convert. If you have trouble finding clothes that not only fit but also complement your very hard-earned physique, then do yourself a favor and go see Greg.

text:
I'm sooo thankful that encore fitness still allows you to bring the little ones in to swim... so if it's where you can't go to the park & spend a few hours (cause of severe allergies like I suffer from) or cause it's cold outside... it's just great cause the wellness center no longer allows you to do this.... as far as a comment I read on here about the bathrooms not always being clean... they aren't staffed to constantly run in behind each person to be sure they didn't leave a mess... some folks are straight up messy don't flush toilets if their toilet paper falls in the floor they leave it for the workers... so seriously if EVERYONE would clean up behind yourself it would help tremendously...
From all the workers in the rehabilitation side to those who work the desk on the fitness side are all so friendly & kind.... such pleasant individuals to greet you or work with you etc.... Again I can't say "Thank you" enough for allowing me to bring my grand babies & have a blast with them on days I just can't be out in all the pollen or when it's just simply cold outside.
If there's ONE thing I like to see  encore get it would be one of this things that wrings your swim suit towels etc out for you so you don't have to leave with soaked swim wear towels or wash clothes etc... but hey I still give them a 5 star simply for allowing the little ones & for being so caring & friendly!! Thanks Encore!!

I will be contacting the appropriate outlets to make sure the worker at this location, and all workers are up to date on the law so they aren't breaking it and humiliating PAYING members.

text: It's ok; not particularly awesome or bad. That's only my experience, though, exercising with weights. They also offer tanning,  a spa, a pool, and childcare, all during staffed hours. I think they also offer aerobic classes. I don't think the place is particularly nasty as one reviewer pointed out. Everyone can improve, though. But that costs labor hours which translates into more $$$ on membership costs. Seems safe enough with a decently lit parking lot. They offer a lot of equipment. For those interested in weight-lifting, they have a power-cage, a smith machine, and numerous weight benches, along with a full (and I mean full) set of dumbells. For those interested in cardio, they have a row of nice treadmills (with in-unit television) and a row of elipticals. Membership runs about $45 a month with a 60 day cancellation period (meaning you pay 2 more months, monthly, even if you stop going). Nice gym, though. Definitely better than Riviera and the Lion's Den across town

name: Jim Hawkins
text: I probably spend 1000.00 a year in this store but I have spent my last dime.  I purchased 4 sweatshirts for my wife at Christmas.  We were out of town at Christmas and of the 4 there was 1 that she did not want.  Because of Covid concerns and some personal issues I was not able to bring the item back for a refund untill today.  While the young man was very nice, he stated that I had waited too long to return this item and that "they" would not allow him to scan the barcode for the refund.  Now I understand this to a point but I am sure that this could have been handled and that I could have recieved my refund.  I would expect a little understanding after the last year we have all had.  This is only a $60.00 item and I can assure you that I will be taking the other $940.00 that I would have spent at Alumni Hall this year to another local store.  I assure you that J&M would have honored my request.  I hope the owner is ok with this loss in potential income for a $60.00 refund.

resp.text:
Hi Jim, we are sorry to hear about your experience at our store in Auburn. We did speak with our staff about this situation. We appreciate you being a loyal customer with us, but we do however have a return policy that our store must abide by. We did extend our return policy to January 1, 2021 due to the pandemic, but it has since returned to the 30 day standard. Normally our return policy is only 30 days after purchase. The return also must be put back on the original form of payment which our staff said you no longer had. We would be happy to offer you a gift card or have your next online order shipping on us. We do value your business. If you wish to receive a gift card or free shipping, email marketing@alumnihallstores.com.

https://www.alumnihall.com/info/returns

text: Horrible experience! The staff wouldn’t let me purchase shoes because they claimed I had already been there earlier that day. I usually NEVER set foot in Finish Line. I have 0 points on my rewards. They also claimed they had footage of me on their security cameras but couldn’t show proof of it. They lied about the shoes they had in stock. I was offered one size, but after some discussion in the back, the staff told me that size wasn’t available anymore and i couldn’t purchase anything because of my “previous visit that morning.” I can’t believe the staff lied and would not let a buying customer purchase from this store, just so they can keep the shoes for themselves!!

name: Chelsea Williams
text: Placed an order online to pick up in store. Received confirmation email but no other communications about pickup. Called customer service to cancel the order after 3 days of hearing nothing and they said I had to call the store. Called this store & they said my order had “already been processed out as if were picked up on accident .” I asked them to go ahead & cancel the order anyway since I clearly had not come to pick it up. They said they would have to see my ID in store to process the cancellation . I asked why no ID was needed to “process it out” to begin with & they said it was a mistake. I asked what happens if I don’t pick up the shoes, thinking they would have to automatically issue the refund, and these people said the shoes would just sit there since their system shows that I had paid & picked them up. They refused to cancel my order & insisted I had to show them my ID to get my money back. Customer service determined that  was A LIE!!! Had to call customer service back & get them to call this store just to get my money back. Terrible customer service. Never shopping here again.

name: Jacob Li
text: Horrible staff. My cousins and I went to buy some Jordan’s at the Finishline in Dothan, Alabama. They let me check out and they then went to get a size 11 for my cousin but then came back to tell us that another employee claimed that he already saw us here earlier this morning. Not only did they refuse show any proof (cameras) that we were here, they were rude and it didn’t seem like they cared. After that, I told my brother to come and get the size 11 for my cousin. They then said that every size had been raffled off and that only size 8 was available! I’m 100% sure that they planned on backdooring the pairs for themselves or to resell. Why would a shoe store manager refuse to sell shoes to customers and lie, claiming that we were here earlier but we all rode in the same car. This is most definitely the shopping worst experience I’ve ever had.

text: Went in for gun cleaning supplies and a new cleaning mat. There were nothing but bare shelves. This isn't ammo, or gun that I'm speaking of now. Yep, a little out of the way, but, I'm going back to the little guys, where it all started anyway.

text: I love Academy Sports so every chance I get when I am traveling, I stop by one.  This one was the least exciting one I have been to.  The shoe selection was lacking for women’s running shoes.  It just seemed such a lackluster store.  The first time I have walked out of an Academy Sports store without spending a penny.

name: CALG RN
text: Bought my water sport gears here. Various brands are sold here, so you have alot of options. Me and my husband also buys ammos here. They have a decent amount of stocks but preferrably go in the morning 'til 12pm, just to make sure you still get some. Only 2 boxes of ammos are allowed per person. Bit pricey, but where else can you find it but here, service is good too. Friendly personnels are working there. We'll keep coming back for sure. Would like to avail the academy member card (but it's a credit card) and don't wanna manage another one.. so yeah.. but if you can, I would encourage you get it and enjoy alot of discounts.

name: Emily Gayle
text: Extremely helpful staff and a pleasant store to go in. I was just not satisfied in the bicycle section for the lack of prices and sizes there. Online they are very organized but the building does not allow for cell service so I could not pull up my wishlist to see what bike matched. Instead I had to crouch down and twirl tires to see what size they were and try to find the size I want. You cannot get a bike in a box which is tricky for storage and wrapping when you want to save the bike for a present. But good that it is assembled by a professional.

name: Edwina Riddlespriger
text: Horrible! Waited in line at the site to store desk while cash only customers were checked out only to be asked if I had checked in to receive my purchase once it was my turn.😡 This is definitely not the process and the cashier seemed to be confused. I then chose to go to my car to utilize the curbside option. While waiting yet again, I called inside of the store to speak with a manager. Once someone finally answered, I asked for the manager and could hear the employee hand someone the telephone. I assumed that I was about to speak with a manager, only to be placed on hold without anyone saying anything to me. I did eventually receive my purchase and the young lady that bought it to me was very nice.

Finally my husband and I picked up the box alone, weighed close to 90 pounds, and carried it to the register passing at least 2 employees on the way who didn't bother to offer to help or get us a cart.  Kinesha at the register greeted us and we tried to explain to her why we had a bad experience but she didn't say another word to us the whole time we were paying except to tell us that they don't offer a military discount (in Montgomery, Alabama miles from an Air Force base).  Called and spoke to Megan the manager and she was nice but we still won't be back.

She did everything in her power to try and help us get the trampoline that we needed, that we had been told multiple times that was available in the store but was a small stock, so we were trying to make sure we got it. Ashlee even went as far as to try and get it available on the website for us so we could reserve it there. Overall, we got dragged around in a circle by this store, and it seemed to be because of a lack of communication between management and employees.

text: Their staff is amazing.  While they are definitely overworked, they remain smiling & helpful despite the overwhelming stress of not being properly staffed to serve all customer traffic.  I witnessed one customer berate an employee because the checkout line was too long of a wait. Yes - it was long, but it's not the fault of the employee, she was working as quickly as she could despite the occasional random customer walked up & interrupted her with some  question, meanwhile she's trying to continue checking out the many patiently-waiting customers in inline. Let's all remember the employees deserve our appreciation & patience during busy shopping times...and they don't make more money during those times, just more stress while the corporate folks take in the sales profits. Just try to treat everyone with the same respect you would like to receive from them.  And Academy employees deserve raises & more hired staff to create a sales team force!!!

name: John Pritchett
text: I am heading to do hurricane relief work in Big Pine Key and am gathering supplies to take with the group of us going down there. I needed to purchase some steel stakes to secure palm trees that are damaged from the storm. I went to the Montgomery Academy Sports Store and purchased these stakes. I talked with the salesman in the back and notified him of our mission and asked him if they could give us some kind of discount and was told no. I asked him to ask the manager and he did and the manager said no. When checking out of the store the manager was up front chit chatting with an employee and a customer ( doing nothing) and I again asked him face to face if he could help us out and he again said no. All the other companies have been good about discounting supplies. Lowe's of Wetumpka,  Marvins in Millbrook,  Harbour Freight,  Home Depot all have been helpful especially Lowe's in Wetumpka. After being told no face to face I told him I appreciated it and then proceeded to name the other companies that have responded responsibly. I have bought alot of product from academy over the years but this experience has left a bad test in my mouth with the company and particularly with this manager. 🚷

name: Emily Doner
text: I have not been to Academy since last spring because of poor service. I just went online ordered a pair of shoes stated I could pick up at the store within the hour. I received a call from the store that they didn’t have my item and that it would be best if I canceled my order. That my money hadn’t been taken out of my account. I tried to cancel online but it kept freezing up. I called the corporate customer service waited on hold for over 30 minutes and then they cut my call off. I then called the Decatur store back and ask for a manager. The girl that answered said “ I’m a manager” she was short and rude with me . Said they would cancel my order and I would get a email or text when it was taken care of. I did receive it and it stated my money would not be back in my bank account until 7 business days. So isn’t that great!! Academy ruins a Christmas present for my daughter. And has not a second thought or concern for me . I tried to do the right thing order from home social distance for everyone’s safety and this is the thanks I get. I paid for an item last spring $ 700 and basically the same thing happened only difference is they didn’t have my purchased item so I had to buy a $100 higher item of the same kind. I guess you make so much money that I make no difference. So I am sure I won’t be missed. But very poor service and no compassion for taking someone’s money at Christmas.. Merry Christmas Academy Sports Decatur!!

name: Jordan Morgan
text: Bought work shoes for my husband and they ended up being too small, so he went to return them the next day August 7 and it is now August 20 and still no return. I've talked to managers and customer service reps and basically have been told this store is very lacking on communication and when my husband talked to one of the managers in the store, since no one would answer the phone, they fed us a lie that it was out of their hands when truly they are the only ones who can clear the matter according to the many customer service reps I've spoke with. We are now on two weeks and still waiting for over a $100 purchase return. They could have sold the shoes in this time. They basically stole from us and we are at their mercy. My suggestion is don't do any business with these people. The carelessness I've experienced has been the biggest headache and for something that is truly so simple as a debit in-store return.

text: Terrible place to work for. Management is unprofessional. Dont even try to express any problems to management. They'll just fire you for your criticism. Half of employees can't even speak proper english so communication in the workplace is below par and management is new and terrible. Hard work isnt appreciated in the workplace so dont expect much other than to be talked to like a dog and terrible work conditions.

text: Ashley Simpson and her staff at Victoria’s Secret Tuscaloosa are amazing. They are so helpful and the store is always so clean. I am thankful for having the store in Tuscaloosa and will always shop here instead of online.

name: Maddie Mills
text: Completely and utterly dissatisfied with my experience at his location this past weekend. Went to take advantage of their sale and happened to get a two piece pajama set as well after I was informed about a promotion they were running. Upon checking out, the cashier told me to just grab a pair of slippers on my way out for the pajama promotion. As I left, I didn't see where to pick these up so I asked a manager and she was suggesting that I was trying to steal because you can't just grab slippers and walk out. Well, if I had not been directed to do so, then I wouldn't have. Turns out, many customers had been told the same thing that day which explains why the alarm kept going off. Ended up walking out after the poor service from the individuals in the store.
